intro: Synaphea endothrix, commonly known as the narrowleaf synaphea, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
